page.title: 04 CUSTOMS AND SUPERSTITIONS
page.content:
{FEBRUARY}- PANCAKES ARE MADE ON {SHROVE TUESDAY. {MARCH 1st}- SAINT DAVID'S DAY . {APRIL 1st}- LOTS OF JOKES ARE PLAYED ON {ALL FOOLS DAY . {MAY}- SERVANTS WERE HIRED AT COUNTY FAIRS. EMPLOYEES PAID HALF A CROWN TO SECURE A WORKMAN . {JULY}- CORN WAS REAPED AND PEAT WAS CUT AND LEFT TO DRY. {AUGUST}-{NATIONAL EISTEDDFOD}TAKES PLACE. BARDS AND DRUIDS HELD CEREMONIES IN{EISTEDDFOD TOWNS. {SEPTEMBER}- FRUIT AND NUTS WERE PICKED AND STORED FOR WINTER. {OCTOBER}-{MICHAELMAS}A MAIN EVENT ON THE FARMS. PIGS WERE KILED AND SALTED. {NOVEMBER}- BONFIRES AND FIREWORKS ARE LIT TO CELEBRATE{GUY FAWKES. {DECEMBER}- PEOPLE CELEBRATE{CHRISTMAS.
**** JOANNE ****
